title: Three years of war seen by Ukrainian soldiers: 'The world hasn't seen a war like this for a long time'
summary: After three years of conflict with Russia, Ukrainian soldiers recount the war's development and the challenges faced on the front line.

title: 'Trump's economic policy lacks any coherence'
summary: One month into the American president's return to the White House, the world is divided between astonishment and fascination. Meanwhile, inflation is rising again, and the effectiveness of public spending cuts remains a facade, says Stéphane Lauer.

title: Ukraine and US finalize minerals deal as Kyiv seeks security assurances
summary: Ukraine has agreed on the terms of a minerals deal with the United States and could sign it as early as Friday, a Ukrainian official has said. The agreement, which follows Trump’s demands for compensation for wartime aid, would see the US jointly develop Ukraine’s mineral resources, with revenues flowing into a shared fund.

title: France's most-wanted indicted on murder and organized crime charges
summary: Mohamed Amra, the fugitive convict whose brazen prison escape left two officers dead, has been formally indicted in Paris after his extradition from Romania. The 30-year-old faces multiple charges, including murder and criminal conspiracy, following a nine-month international manhunt that ended with his capture in Bucharest.

title: 299 victims, 65 lawyers, 75 days: The complex logistics of France's largest-ever child abuse trial
summary: The 90-seat courtroom in Vannes, Brittany, was too small to host the extraordinary trial of Joël Le Scouarnec. After various options were considered, a spillover room was arranged to show broadcasts in a neighboring former law faculty.

title: A touch of fantasy at London Fashion Week
summary: Faux fur has made its way into the Fall-Winter 2025-2026 collections, on black tops and shorts at Simone Rocha or toques and bags at Toga.

title: Massive blackout hits Chile, hundreds evacuated from Santiago metro
summary: A rare and widespread power outage swept across Chile on Tuesday, cutting electricity from the northern city of Arica to Los Lagos in the south. The blackout forced the evacuation of Santiago’s metro, caused massive traffic jams, and left businesses shuttered, though officials ruled out sabotage, citing a likely system failure.

title: Trump administration to take control of media access at White House
summary: The move comes amid a legal battle with the Associated Press news agency, which the White House has barred from events in spaces such as the Oval Office and Air Force One in a row over the naming of the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Poland wishes to become a shareholder in Airbus
summary: The aerospace group's CEO is due to visit Warsaw shortly. He is hoping for a major order from the country, which has traditionally preferred to buy American.

title: Trump-Macron meeting illustrates growing distance between allies
summary: Visiting Washington, the French president tried to influence the US position on the war in Ukraine, seeking security guarantees in the event of a ceasefire with Russia. But the US president made no commitment.

title: Dismantling of USAID: 'The butterfly effect has made a national scandal into an instant global crisis'
summary: Former French education minister Najat Vallaud-Belkacem and lecturer Guillaume Gonin warn that the dismantling of the US Agency for International Development by Donald Trump's administration is going to have disastrous health, humanitarian and geopolitical consequences.

title: NGOs ask ICC to investigate Biden's complicity in 'Israeli war crimes' in Gaza
summary: Two human rights organizations have submitted a document to the International Criminal Court accusing the former US president, as well as his Secretary of State Antony Blinken, and his Secretary of Defense Lloyd Austin.

title: Macron to brief EU leaders on Trump Ukraine talks
summary: Europe has scrambled for a unified response since Trump two weeks ago declared his readiness to negotiate with Russia – and without European involvement – on ending the three-year-old Ukraine war.

title: Madrid shocked by removal of Spanish from White House website
summary: Though spoken by nearly 58 million people in the US, the Spanish language disappeared from the official White House website and social networks a few hours after Donald Trump's inauguration, as during his first term in office.

title: Who is Friedrich Merz, Germany's next chancellor?
summary: Angela Merkel's rival, a corporate lawyer and millionaire, and a politician accused of cooperating with the far-right AfD party... Here's what you need to know about Merz.

title: British PM pledges to spend 2.5% of GDP on defense by 2027
summary: Keir Starmer expressed an intent to eventually reach 3%, a rise of 0.7% from current spending that would mark the biggest increase since the end of the Cold War.

title: Nice church attack suspect admits at trial to killing three people, expressing no remorse
summary: For the first time, Brahim Aouissaoui confessed to committing three murders on October 29, 2020, without going into details. He expressed no regret, claiming the 'right' to avenge Muslims killed around the world.

title: Trump flies to the rescue of New York City mayor Eric Adams
summary: The mayor of New York, who is accused of corruption and illegal campaign financing, could escape prosecution, at the government's request. Prosecutors and magistrates have since been resigning in quick succession.

title: In France, a political debate out of phase with global upheavals
summary: Faced with the American ideological onslaught, most French politicians seem bewildered and not up to the task, at the risk of lagging behind history.

title: Israel kills two in Syria strikes as Hamas confirms prisoner release deal
summary: Israel carried out airstrikes on military sites in southern Syria on Tuesday, killing at least two people, just days after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu called for the region’s demilitarization. The strikes came as Hamas confirmed an agreement, under Egyptian mediation, to release Palestinian prisoners in exchange for the bodies of four Israeli hostages.

title: 'Donald Trump's tariff protectionism is an unprecedented shock; the consequences of which are difficult to gauge'
summary: In his column for 'Le Monde,' the Journalist Julien Bouissou writes that the new US customs policy will have two troubling consequences for Europe. It will redirect Chinese exports towards Europe and push European manufacturers to relocate to the US.

title: 'Queer': In Mexico, Daniel Craig flees existential loneliness
summary: Adapted from a novel by William S. Burroughs, Luca Guadagnino's film casts the James Bond performer in the role of a drug-addicted American writer in search of love and connection.

title: Trump announces $5 million ‘gold card’ visa
summary: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday unveiled plans to sell a new 'gold card' residency permit for $5 million, positioning it as a way to attract wealthy investors and reduce the national deficit. Trump suggested that up to a million of these high-priced visas could be sold–and when asked if Russian oligarchs could apply, he said it was 'possible.'

title: Police raids target several USAID-funded NGOs in Serbia
summary: Four Serbian pro-democracy organizations, partly funded by the US, were targeted in a judicial investigation directly inspired by the obsessions of the new US administration.

title: Researchers stunned by denial of biodiversity collapse: 'We're right, not the lobbies'
summary: As the COP16 biodiversity negotiations resume in Italy on Tuesday, scientists are expressing their amazement at the setbacks affecting nature conservation, but are trying to fight back with what they have.

title: War in Ukraine: 'Eleven years ago, on Maidan Square, the candles were already there'
summary: Somewhere between evocation and documentation, photographer Rafael Yaghobzadeh captures the way Russia's war on Ukraine, since 2014, has intruded on everyday life, far from the front line.

title: Tesla stocks plunge, signaling end of markets' Trump euphoria
summary: Elon Musk's company valuation fell below the $1 trillion mark on Tuesday, and its share price is down. While Donald Trump's election had been followed by a surge in the stock market, signs of concern are now emerging.

title: Critically-ill pope has peaceful night, reports Vatican
summary: Pope Francis is being treated in Rome for pneumonia in both lungs and remains in a critical condition, according to the Vatican.

title: 'Crises are Macron's fuel, and Europe is his strongest asset'
summary: Since 2017, the French president has developed a clear and prescient vision for Europe's global role, allowing him to make a comeback after his calamitous decision to call early elections, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: Germany's Social Democrats in turmoil after historic general election defeat
summary: Germany's Social Democratic Party faces a lack of leadership following its defeat on February 23, having garnered only 16.5% of the vote, its worst score since 1945.

title: Far from the front, Russians live with the normalization of war
summary: The recruitment of volunteers has avoided the need for official military mobilization. Three years after the start of the Kremlin's offensive in Ukraine, almost 80% of Russians say they support the 'special military operation.'

title: EU presents emergency competitiveness plan
summary: On Wednesday, February 26, the European Commission presented a number of proposals to support the decarbonization of industry.

title: French convict 'The Fly' placed in solitary confinement after extradition from Romania
summary: Arrested in Romania and returned to France on Tuesday evening, drug trafficker and fugitive Mohamed Amra has been indicted for 'murder, attempted murder, escape, theft and concealment of theft,' as well as for 'criminal conspiracy.'

title: Stéphane Séjourné: "'Made in Europe' is making its way into European legislation"
summary: The European Union's executive arm, responsible for industrial strategy, believes there is an 'urgent need' for action in this sector.
